alert.note: Alert for Dubuque; Jackson; Jones (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 26 at 3:42PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Jackson, southern Dubuque and northeastern Jones Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 341 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bernard, or 13 miles south of Dubuque, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds and possibly weak, brief tornadoes and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Isolated damage to roofs, siding and trees is possible. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dubuque, Epworth, Farley, Peosta, Centralia, Bernard, Zwingle, Swiss Valley Park, Key West, Dubuque Regional Airport, Garry Owen, Fillmore, Rockdale, Mines of Spain, Fillmore Recreation Area, Lattnerville, Dubuque County Fairgrounds, Massey, and Washington Mills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of funnel clouds, and possibly brief, weak tornadoes. The National Weather Service will conntinue to closely monitor the situation, and may issue a Tornado Warning if the threat increases. If you see a funnel cloud please seek shelter indoors and then contact your local law enforcement agency for relay to the National Weather Service. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
